Articles.Content:
MRS, I'm having trouble with Kronal Vessel Viewer, and I know you use it. When I try to open it, it just flickers an image of the craft and won't allow ne to tweak any of the settings or take a photo. Did you ever have this problem?

No, I haven't had this problem, maybe it's caused my another mod?

You might try this thread: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75554-Exploded-ship-view-Axes-on-the-VAB-other-stuff-now-released-into-public-domain
Just a prototype, but it needs a rebuild, right?

Sweet bliss. The Copernicus DTV is completely complete! It's just sitting in the VAB now lookin' fabulous. It's a quantum leap over my old one, I can't wait till release.

Just a prototype, but it needs a rebuild, right?

Looks great! You're really good at capturing the shape of spacecraft.

Just a prototype, but it needs a rebuild, right?

http://i.imgur.com/8XyXXKF.png

That looks interesting dude, what's the part count?

Sweet bliss. The Copernicus DTV is completely complete! It's just sitting in the VAB now lookin' fabulous. It's a quantum leap over my old one, I can't wait till release.

Looks great! You're really good at capturing the shape of spacecraft.

Ohh, I can't wait! Thanks, here's another picture of it:

That looks interesting dude, what's the part count?

Thanks, it has 82 parts.

Ohh, I can't wait! Thanks, here's another picture of it:

http://i.imgur.com/kHAqdGM.png

http://i.imgur.com/PqyiX0b.png

Thanks, it has 82 parts.

This is looking awesome! I was in two minds about the SPR detail when I built mine. You've done it in fewer parts than me. Good job. There should be a little gap between the wheels though. And the ones in the video don't have the rear tray, just a hatch. I remade mine to look that way.

So, it seats two kerbals?

This is looking awesome! I was in two minds about the SPR detail when I built mine. You've done it in fewer parts than me. Good job. There should be a little gap between the wheels though. And the ones in the video don't have the rear tray, just a hatch. I remade mine to look that way.

So, it seats two kerbals?

Thanks! I'm rebuilding the windscreen, which will add a bunch of parts. I think I'll stick with the tray, I think I like how it looks better that way. It should seat 3 kerbals, but I haven't tested that yet.

Thanks! I'm rebuilding the windscreen, which will add a bunch of parts. I think I'll stick with the tray, I think I like how it looks better that way. It should seat 3 kerbals, but I haven't tested that yet.

http://i.imgur.com/rxhJPCG.png

OOh klever! I have the black parts for that, I'm happy so far with them. It's 106 parts.

OOh klever! I have the black parts for that, I'm happy so far with them. It's 106 parts.

Thanks!

Here's some images of the semi-finished product:

(Prototype model, may be subject to change.)

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited June 12, 2015 by Mad Rocket Scientist
Thank! Thank? Thank.

Thanks!

Here's some images of the semi-finished product:

(Prototype model, may be subject to change.)

http://imgur.com/a/4yyBr

You've done me proud.

I still really like my original!

I miss those little White panels..

I have a question. The DTV has two Orions docked to it in LEO, one to the front of the TransHab and one docked to the T-truss. Are both sent up by Ares Is, or is one of them sent up with the section of DTV? And which one is which?

EDIT: Never mind, found the answer. One Orion is sent up on the last Ares V DTV cargo launch dock to the front of the TransHab, and the crew docks to the T-truss. I may just do two Ares I launches.

Edited June 12, 2015 by Zucal

My cargo lander is 536 parts and counting...

At least I have the DIPS, FSPS, and SPR installed.

My cargo lander is 536 parts and counting...

http://i.imgur.com/Vrr098m.png

http://i.imgur.com/1sV38Ad.png

At least I have the DIPS, FSPS, and SPR installed.

That's really coming along nicely man. That part count will be a problem though..

That's really coming along nicely man. That part count will be a problem though..

Thanks! With any luck, there shouldn't be too many more parts, I'm going to use wings for the exterior, and I'll need some fuel tanks, but that should be it!

How are people coming along now?

Thanks! With any luck, there shouldn't be too many more parts, I'm going to use wings for the exterior, and I'll need some fuel tanks, but that should be it!

How are people coming along now?

Progress is halted by fairings and performance issues.. I have a dv issue in one of the craft.

Have you tried a powered landing with the landers yet?

Progress is halted by fairings and performance issues.. I have a dv issue in one of the craft.

Have you tried a powered landing with the landers yet?

Sorry, I don't think I'm going to have a dv problem with my NTRPP, 10,000 dv unloaded, with not all of the fuel tanks loaded.

I haven't yet tried a powered landing, but I will soon.

Sorry, I don't think I'm going to have a dv problem with my NTRPP, 10,000 dv unloaded, with not all of the fuel tanks loaded.

I haven't yet tried a powered landing, but I will soon.

Its with the Ares V.. My DTV also has huge dv capability. Due to the tank arrangement. Look forward to more progress!
My lander currently is 300 parts with aeroshell. I feel better.

My builds have quite a bit of detail, which means less dv. Kerbal Engineer can't measure the DTV's dv accurately because of the drop tank, but it has enough for a round trip. My cargo lander has around 650 dv, although I'll probably add more fuel. Ares I and the NTR propulsion stage could both probably use some more. Orion on its own has almost 2100.

My lander currently is 300 parts with aeroshell. I feel better.

What! How did you do that!?

Ugh, work, work work. Irl.

I'm not gonna pull this off as fast as I was going to.

Oh well.

Originally Posted by Yukon0009

My lander currently is 300 parts with aeroshell. I feel better.

What! How did you do that!?

My cargo lander is only 198.
Also, here are four photos of the SPR interior. Looks pretty cozy, actually!

Also, here are four photos of the SPR interior. Looks pretty cozy, actually!

Yeah it really does! I am completely in love with the SPR. I wonder if scale models exist of it?

Starting work on Altair, trying to find a way that is different from all the Oscar-B/xenon tank ones.

Also, I haven't shown much of my stuff, so pick one: Copernicus DTV or SPR rover?
